definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: It was, instead, an example of Chinese stagecraft.
sentences.chinese: 這次對話是中國式做戲的一個典範。

sentences.english: The motifs are classic Chinese ones that are variations on themes that go all the way back to Zhou dynasty bronzes .
sentences.chinese: 圖案是典型的中國式，以周朝青銅器上的圖案爲遠祖。

sentences.english: Why did Kim Jong Il never launch China-style economic reforms?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼金正日從不啓動中國式經濟改革？

sentences.english: Many Mongolians suspected a Chinese-style political squeeze.
sentences.chinese: 許多蒙古人懷疑這是中國式的政治施壓。

sentences.english: The man found it difficult to get his Chinese humor across to the English audience.
sentences.chinese: 那人發現自己的中國式幽默很難爲英國聽衆理解。

sentences.english: I'm very fond of clothes of your Chinese style, and I'd like to buy a TangZhuang overcoat.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜歡你們中國式的衣服，我想要買一件唐裝外套。

sentences.english: Call it the Monroe Doctrine, Chinese style.
sentences.chinese: 有人稱之爲“中國式的門羅主義“。

sentences.english: Chinese Bamboo garden is also a part of the bamboo culture.
sentences.chinese: 中國式竹園也是竹文化的一部分。

sentences.english: They also made sure to build the panda's cage out of Chinese dry wall.
sentences.chinese: 他們還給熊貓砌中國式的清水牆在籠子裏。

sentences.english: Could it be the history of Chinese-style theory, will also communicate with the Chinese literary theory of tonight's?
sentences.chinese: 莫非中國式的歷史論，也將溝通了中國人的文學論歟？

sentences.english: It is a Chinese style family drama.
sentences.chinese: 一部中國式的家庭情節劇。

sentences.english: Crossed-cousin marriage is not allowed in China.
sentences.chinese: 姑表兄妹在中國式不允許結婚的。

sentences.english: A:I'm very fond of clothes of your Chinese style, and I’d like to buy a TangZhuang overcoat.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜歡你們中國式的衣服，我想要買一件唐裝外套。

sentences.english: Six years on, that is not the story of today's Chinese-style divorces.
sentences.chinese: 六年後的今天，中國式離婚的情況已經與此不同了。

sentences.english: Here's a story in favor of coercion, Chinese-style.
sentences.chinese: 下面是個中國式強迫的正面例子。

sentences.english: It's a type of Chinese cracker , made from rice and shrimp.
sentences.chinese: 是中國式的餅乾，用米與蝦肉做的。

definition: to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
